newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Armenian harvest ends, output rises to 340,200 T.
newsitem.headline: Armenian harvest ends, output rises to 340,200 T.

text.p: The former Soviet republic of Armenia's grain harvest is over, and output this year rose by 67,000 tonnes to 340,200 tonnes, Interfax news agency quoted agriculture officials in Tbilisi as saying on Friday.
No data was immediately available on the tiny country's annual consumption.

Cash-strapped Armenia, in the throes of economic crisis, has no money for grain imports and in the past has covered shortfalls with humanitarian aid deliveries and barter operations with the former Soviet republics.

The U.S, Department of Agriculture's Commodity Credit Corp said in August it had bought 16,506 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat from Continental Grain Corp for Armenia under an export donation programme.
